questions.fact: AI models like GPT-4 are trained on large datasets of text from the internet and books. (Example 1)
questions.myth: AI models like GPT-4 have access to the live internet and can browse websites in real-time. (Example 1)

questions.fact: Generative AI can create new content like text, images, and music based on patterns it learned during training. (Example 2)
questions.myth: Generative AI creates truly original content that has never existed before, completely independent of its training data. (Example 2)

questions.fact: AI image generators like DALL-E and Midjourney create images based on text descriptions. (Example 3)
questions.myth: AI image generators take photos of real objects and just modify them slightly. (Example 3)

questions.fact: AI models can make mistakes and generate incorrect information sometimes called 'hallucinations'. (Example 5)
questions.myth: AI models always provide 100% accurate information because they're programmed to be error-free. (Example 5)

questions.fact: Prompt engineering is the practice of crafting effective inputs to get better outputs from AI models. (Example 6)
questions.myth: Prompt engineering is the process of physically building AI hardware components. (Example 6)

questions.fact: AI models can be fine-tuned on specific datasets to improve performance for particular tasks. (Example 7)
questions.myth: Once an AI model is created, its capabilities are fixed and cannot be modified or improved. (Example 7)

questions.fact: Generative AI models have parameters that can number in the billions or trillions. (Example 8)
questions.myth: The more parameters an AI model has, the slower it always becomes at generating responses. (Example 8)

questions.fact: AI can assist with creative tasks but works best when collaborating with human creativity. (Example 9)
questions.myth: AI will soon replace all creative professionals like artists, writers, and musicians. (Example 9)

questions.fact: AI models have a 'context window' that limits how much information they can consider at once. (Example 11)

questions.fact: Transfer learning allows AI models to apply knowledge from one task to help with another task. (Example 12)
